avalancheActivity.comment: Along the border with Switzerland The more recent wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads, in particular on steep shady slopes and generally in high Alpine regions. This applies in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls, as well as on wind-loaded slopes especially above approximately 2400 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Along the border with Switzerland Wind slabs at elevated altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment: In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. Faceted weak layers exist in the snowpack on wind-loaded slopes. At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying. Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to consolidation of the snowpack at low and intermediate altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In these regions from a snow sport perspective, insufficient snow is lying.
Even in moderately steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In all aspects a little snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment: Hardly any snow is lying at intermediate and high altitudes. The snowpack is stable and its surface has a resilient crust.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche prone locations are rather rare. These avalanche prone locations are to be found above approximately 2600 m.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In all aspects as well as in all altitude zones only a little snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment: Below approximately 2400 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying. At higher altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Wind slabs are to be found especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls and generally at elevated altitudes. These can in isolated cases be released, mostly by large loads.
In many places there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The snowpack will be quite stable. Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to consolidation of the snowpack in all altitude zones.
In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.
